structured_notes_xml:
<structured_notes>
    <project_name>Fitness Tracking App</project_name>
    <company_overview>Not specified</company_overview>
    <attendees>
        <attendee>Sarah (PM)</attendee>
        <attendee>Mike (Tech Lead)</attendee>
        <attendee>Jessica (Designer)</attendee>
        <attendee>Tom (Marketing)</attendee>
    </attendees>
    <meeting_date>January 15, 2025</meeting_date>
    <meeting_objective>Brainstorm ideas for a new fitness tracking app, including features and target audience.</meeting_objective>
    <key_discussion_points>
        <point>Introduction to the app idea: tracking workouts, potentially nutrition and sleep.</point>
        <point>Tom highlights the popularity of sleep tracking and mentions competitors like Whoop, Oura Ring, and Apple Watch.</point>
        <point>Mike expresses concern about competing with resource-rich companies like Apple.</point>
        <point>Sarah proposes targeting beginners in fitness rather than hardcore athletes.</point>
        <point>Jessica supports the beginner focus and suggests keeping the app simple to avoid overwhelming users with metrics and graphs.</point>
        <point>Discussion on making the app user-friendly and not complex.</point>
        <point>Emphasis on differentiating from existing products by focusing on simplicity.</point>
    </key_discussion_points>
    <pain_points>
        <pain_point>Competition with established companies like Apple that have significant resources.</pain_point>
    </pain_points>
    <requirements>
        <requirement>Track workouts for users.</requirement>
        <requirement>Possibly include nutrition tracking.</requirement>
        <requirement>Consider sleep tracking as a feature.</requirement>
        <requirement>Design the app to be simple and beginner-friendly, avoiding overwhelming metrics.</requirement>
    </requirements>
    <decisions_made>
        <decision>Focus the app on beginners in their fitness journey rather than hardcore athletes.</decision>
        <decision>Emphasize simplicity in the app design to make it accessible.</decision>
    </decisions_made>
    <action_items>
    </action_items>
    <technical_constraints>
    </technical_constraints>
    <stakeholders>
        <stakeholder>Sarah (PM)</stakeholder>
        <stakeholder>Mike (Tech Lead)</stakeholder>
        <stakeholder>Jessica (Designer)</stakeholder>
        <stakeholder>Tom (Marketing)</stakeholder>
    </stakeholders>
</structured_notes>
